## R notebook to compare and plot the Markhov Chain probability distribution, vs a sample after running the experiment.
### Load libraries and set parameters
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(Matrix)

t <-  3
Beta <- 0.6
Gamma <- 0
N <- 60
```
### Generate overlapping graph
```{r, file=c('src/Experiment.R', 'src/MarkhovChain.R')}


mass_matrix = markhov_probability(times=t, beta=Beta, gamma=Gamma, initial_S=N-1, initial_I=1)

df = data.frame(I=as.integer(colnames(mass_matrix)), P=as.vector(mass_matrix))
ggplot(data = df, aes(x = I)) + 
  geom_col(aes(y=P),color="aliceblue", fill=alpha("blue", 0.4)) + 
  geom_col(aes(y=E), color="seashell", fill=alpha("red1", 0.4))
  ylab('P(I)') +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(plot.title=element_text(family="sans", hjust = 0.5)) +
  ggtitle("PMF for Infection")
# data.frame(markov_virus(end_time=60,beta=0.88, gamma=0.4, S=59, I=1))
```
